snippet: As reports show that the global economic slowdown is worsening, investors speculate that central banks will do more to stimulate growth.
abstract: European stocks rise for a second day on speculation that central banks will take more steps to stimulate growth, as reports signal the global economic slowdown is deepening; markets in the United States are closed for the Labor Day holiday.
lead_paragraph: As reports show that the global economic slowdown is worsening, investors speculate that central banks will do more to stimulate growth.

headline.seo: Stocks Rise in Europe on Hopes for Economic Stimulus
headline.main: Expectation of Stimulus Lifts European Markets
headline.print_headline: Expectation of Stimulus Lifts European Markets
